events.title: Cro-Magnon man is flourishing
events.story: Cro-Magnon man is flourishing, moving from the Near East into Europe, lives by hunting and gathering. Cro-Magnon/'s painted caves with drawings of the animals they killed.

events.title: Bering Strait is crossed by humans
events.story: Bering Strait is crossed by humans, connecting Asia to the Americas.

events.title: Clay pottery. Raw metals use.
events.story: Clay pottery ware is created. Humans begin to use raw metals.

events.title: Humans make it to the southern most point of South America.
events.story: Humans make it to the southern most point of South America.

events.location: the Fertile Cresen, Middle Eastern area
events.title: The Neolithic Revolution and an agriculture way of life is discovered
events.story: The Neolithic Revolution and an agriculture way of life is discovered in the Fertile Cresent/Middle Eastern area. Cows and sheep were domesticated and crops where manipulated and tended.(interesting fact: first domesticated dog ever was found in Idaho, USA 8400 BC).

events.title: A great earthquake destroys the city of Jericho
events.story: A great earthquake destroys the city of Jericho.

events.title: The oceans and sea's rise
events.story: The oceans and sea’s rise, England is now cut off from Europe by land.

events.title: .    First beer is brewed from grain
events.story: .    First beer is brewed from grain in the Near East.

events.title: First settled societies
events.story: First settled societies in the Mesopotamia region.

events.title: Humans learn how to use the plow.
events.story: Humans learn how to use the plow.

events.title: Development of copper and bronze metallurgy.
events.story: Development of copper and bronze metallurgy.

events.title: The very first year on the Egyptian calendar.
events.story: The very first year on the Egyptian calendar.

events.title: The wheel is invented and begins to be used. Rice farming
events.story: The wheel is invented and begins to be used. Rice farming in China is developed.

events.title: Beginning forms of writing. Earliest ziggurats are built.
events.story: Beginning forms of writing. Earliest ziggurats are built.

events.title: First date in the Mayan calendar
events.story: First date in the Mayan calendar.

events.title: Egypt's 1st Dynasty.
events.story: Egypt's 1st Dynasty created by the joining of the upper and lower kingdoms of Egypt.

events.title: Bricks for construction. importance of Temples. Military campaigns.
events.story: Bricks are used widely(and made by a fired process). First city-states are created, palaces are starting to be build. Temples are usually build at the center of the cities.There were large military campaigns by ethnic groups of people.

events.title: Rule of Gilgamesh. King of Uruk.
events.story: Rule of Gilgamesh. King of Uruk.

events.title: Very first pyramids were built
events.story: Very first pyramids were built in Egypt.

events.title: First written legal codes.
events.story: First written legal codes.

events.title: The construction of Stonehenge
events.story: The construction of Stonehenge in England starts.

events.title: Hammurabi begins his rule as king.
events.story: Hammurabi begins his rule as king.

events.title: The Hittites conquer Babylon.
events.story: The Hittites conquer Babylon.

events.title: A young boy named Tutankhamun succeeds Akhenaten, he restores the nation to worshiping the old Egyptian gods.
events.story: A young boy named Tutankhamun succeeds Akhenaten, he restores the nation to worshiping the old Egyptian gods.

events.title: Iran construction, Israelites Exodus
events.story: Ziggurat in Khuzestan, in present day Iran is built. Moses leads the Israelites on an exodus out of Egypt.

events.title: Moses leads his people out of Egypt.
events.story: Moses leads his people out of Egypt.

events.title: The First North African city of Utica (Tunisia) is established by the Phoenicians.
events.story: The First North African city of Utica (Tunisia) is established by the Phoenicians.

events.title: Nebuchadnezzar I begins his rule as king of Babylon.
events.story: Nebuchadnezzar I begins his rule as king of Babylon.

events.title: The Chou Dynasty and the feudal system
events.story: The Chou Dynasty is formed in China by Emperor Wu Wang. The feudal system follows.

events.title: The New Kingdom phase, the XXIst Dynasty formation
events.story: The New Kingdom phase in Egypt is over when Rameses XI dies. Smendes ascends to Pharaoh and forms the XXIst Dynasty.

events.title: The Kingdom of Kush
events.story: The Kingdom of Kush in Nubia begins.

events.title: Israel is invaded and defeated by the Philistines.
events.story: Israel is invaded and defeated by the Philistines.

events.title: Saul is anointed king of Israel by the one of the last remaining Israelite judges.
events.story: Saul is anointed king of Israel by the one of the last remaining Israelite judges.

events.title: In the battle of Gilboa, Saul is killed and David ascends to the throne.
events.story: In the battle of Gilboa, Saul is killed and David ascends to the throne.

events.title: David dies and his throne is replaced by his son Solomon.
events.story: David dies and his throne is replaced by his son Solomon.

events.title: The Dedication of Temple at Jerusalem is built by Solomon.
events.story: The Dedication of Temple at Jerusalem is built by Solomon.

events.title: Solomon dies and his throne is replaced by his son Rehoboam who faces a rebellion soon after his ascension.
events.story: Solomon dies and his throne is replaced by his son Rehoboam who faces a rebellion soon after his ascension.

events.title: Carthage is founded by the Phoenicians, not far from Utica.
events.story: Carthage is founded by the Phoenicians, not far from Utica.

events.title: The great poet Homer writes The Iliad and The Odyssey
events.story: The great poet Homer writes The Iliad and The Odyssey

events.title: The very first recorded Olympic Games are established
events.story: The very first recorded Olympic Games are established in Greece.

events.title: The Eastern Chou Dynasty
events.story: The Eastern Chou Dynasty in China begins.

events.title: Buddha death
events.story: Buddha dies in India.

events.title: Hippocrates is born.
events.story: Hippocrates is born.

events.title: The Government of the Thirty Tyrants begins.
events.story: The Government of the Thirty Tyrants begins.

events.title: Spartan forces win the Battle of Coronea.
events.story: Spartan forces win the Battle of Coronea.

events.title: The city of Rome is ransacked by The Gauls from France.
events.story: The city of Rome is ransacked by The Gauls from France.

events.title: Antalcidas of Sparta forms a peace pact with Persia.
events.story: Antalcidas of Sparta forms a peace pact with Persia.

events.title: Hippocrates dies.
events.story: Hippocrates dies.

events.title: Sparta and The Athenian League form a peace pact.
events.story: Sparta and The Athenian League form a peace pact.

events.title: Rome elects its first plebeian council member.
events.story: Rome elects its first plebeian council member.

events.title: The Third Sacred War begins.
events.story: The Third Sacred War begins.

events.title: The Fourth Sacred War begins.
events.story: The Fourth Sacred War begins.

events.title: Philip II of Macedonia is assassinated.
events.story: Philip II of Macedonia is assassinated.

events.title: Alexander the Great invades Egypt and founds the city Alexandria.
events.story: Alexander the Great invades Egypt and founds the city Alexandria.

events.title: The First Punic War begins.
events.story: The First Punic War begins.

events.title: China unification
events.story: China is united under the reign of Shi Huangdi, China's first emperor.

events.title: Construction begins on The Great Wall of China.
events.story: Construction begins on The Great Wall of China.

events.title: Construction is completed on The Great Wall of China.
events.story: Construction is completed on The Great Wall of China.

events.title: Roman forces defeat Perseus at the Battle of Pydna.
events.story: Roman forces defeat Perseus at the Battle of Pydna.

events.title: Jewish people liberate Jerusalem.
events.story: Jewish people liberate Jerusalem.

events.title: Wu (Liu Che) becomes Martial Emperor of China.
events.story: Wu (Liu Che) becomes Martial Emperor of China.

events.title: First Mithridatic War.
events.story: First Mithridatic War.

events.title: Judea is captured by the Roman empire.
events.story: Judea is captured by the Roman empire.

events.title: The Battle of Carrhae.
events.story: The Battle of Carrhae, between Parthian and Roman empires.

events.title: France is conquered by Julius Caesar.
events.story: France is conquered by Julius Caesar.

events.title: Caesar becomes dictator of Rome.
events.story: Caesar becomes dictator of Rome.

events.title: Caesar is assassinated.
events.story: Caesar is assassinated.

events.title: Egypt, a province of the current Roman empire.
events.story: Egypt is absorbed and becomes a province of the current Roman empire.

events.title: Augustus,the first Roman emperor.
events.story: Augustus begins his rule of the Roman Empire as the first Roman emperor.

events.title: Jesus is born
events.story: Jesus is born in Bethlehem.
